page_content: The page titled "Aktuelle Spitalplanung" provides information on hospital planning in the Canton of Zurich, including details on acute care, psychiatry, rehabilitation, and specific requirements for hospitals.

The page outlines the "Grundkompetenzen Erwachsene" program in the Canton of Zürich, aimed at supporting adults with basic competencies for everyday life and work. It includes information about digital competencies, the introduction of a digital learning platform (eLounge), and various initiatives to support adults in using information and communication technologies (ICT).

The page provides an overview of various vocational training opportunities in the Canton of Zürich, including commercial, technical, scientific, and gastronomic fields. It highlights ICT professions, such as "Entwickler/in digitales Business EFZ," "ICT-Fachfrau/Fachmann EFZ," "Informatikerin/Informatiker EFZ Fachrichtung Applikationsentwicklung," and "Informatikerin/Informatiker EFZ Fachrichtung Plattformentwicklung," detailing their roles, responsibilities, and skills required.
The page provides a comprehensive guide on how to use the eQuest web portal for withholding tax accounting in the Canton of Zurich.

The page details the concept for the creation of an intercantonal mathematics textbook for secondary level I, including the production of software components such as CD-ROMs and DVDs for educational purposes.

The page offers information on various courses and training programs for school authorities in Zurich, including an online handbook for school boards and school leaders with instructions and guidance on school management.

The page details the strategy for road drainage in the Canton of Zurich, including guidelines, regulations, and downloadable PDF documents related to the planning and execution of water protection measures.

The page provides information on energy analysis for large consumers in the Canton of Zurich, including guidelines, agreements, requirements, and downloadable PDF documents and Excel tools for energy consumption analysis.

The page provides a detailed guide and instructions for reporting within the Integration Agenda of the Canton of Zurich (IAZH), including data collection, transmission, financial accounting, and the use of specific tools like Excel templates and Fallführungssoftware.

The page provides instructions for institutions to register for ZHservices Business, a digital platform for handling various administrative tasks with the cantonal administration. It includes guides for registration and data transfer in PDF format.

The page offers a toolbox and resources for organizing parent education, including downloadable guides in PDF and DOCX formats on topics such as planning, conducting, and evaluating parent education events.

The page provides information about the J+S-Allround (Children) training for supplementary school care, including course details, eligibility, and downloadable PDF guides for sample children's sports courses.

The page provides comprehensive information on groundwater protection in the Canton of Zurich, including regulations, zoning, and downloadable guides in PDF and DOCX formats for creating protection zone regulations, guidelines, and other related documents.

The page provides detailed information about hospital schooling in the Canton of Zurich, including regulations, guidelines, and downloadable guides in PDF, DOCX, and XLSX formats for the operation of hospital and clinic schools, supervision, individual instruction, and financial reporting.

The webpage details the release of a new French teaching material called "dis donc!" for primary classes in Zurich. It includes both print and digital formats, with the digital components accessible online through browsers. The digital platform offers interactive exercises, videos, and additional materials, and is managed through the Lehrmittelverlag Zürich's licensing platform.

The webpage provides information on various personnel-related topics, including the introduction of an electronic booking journal and an electronic payroll journal within the Canton of Zurich. It includes details on access, necessary permissions, and the transition from paper to electronic versions.

The page provides guidelines and resources for developing and designing web offerings for the Canton of Zurich. It includes information on design systems, content creation, accessibility, and analytics, with specific components, patterns, and guidelines.

The page provides comprehensive guidelines on offering services through websites and web applications, including principles for good services, how to create online forms, and the differentiation between services with and without login. It also outlines the structure and naming conventions for services, with examples and instructions for various scenarios.

The page outlines the civil engineering projects in the Canton of Zurich, including road construction, maintenance, and planning. It also provides downloadable documents related to Building Information Modeling (BIM) and other technical standards.

The page contains a guide for creating tax declarations using electronic tools (PC), including requirements for PC-generated tax forms, guidelines for software developers, and a downloadable PDF document.

The page provides comprehensive information on tax declarations for natural persons in the Canton of Zurich, including online and offline software for tax filing, downloadable forms, and guides. It also offers links to various PDF documents and software downloads for different operating systems.

Information for hunting license holders in the Canton of Zürich, including shooting practice, wild damage prevention, wild meat hygiene, hunting operations, and the use of an electronic database for wildlife management (eFJ).

The page outlines the plan for the integration of ICT in Zurich's primary schools by 2022, including the development of digital learning resources, the implementation of the ICT-Guide, and the need for infrastructure and training.

The page details the introduction of a new French teaching material "dis donc!" for secondary schools, including its structure, methodology, digital learning platform, and implementation schedule in the canton of Zurich.
The page provides various training and technical materials for civil protection, including guides and manuals in different formats such as PDF, DOC, and XLS.
The page provides a guide on how to access and download free geodata using the GIS-Browser of the Canton of Zürich, including visual instructions and a video tutorial.

It mentions the development of new hardware and software influencing traffic data collection and provides a downloadable manual related to traffic engineering.

The page provides information about open data tools, including how to filter catalogs, use web services, and apply open-source software and programming languages. It also offers guidelines for structuring open data and available data formats.

The page provides a guide on how to create instructions for websites and web applications within the Canton of Zürich's design system. It includes details on creating ordered lists, checklists, and ensuring that instructions are user-friendly.

The page provides tools and guidelines for planning the school year in the Canton of Zürich, including calculation tools, planning tools, and instructions for school leaders. It includes downloadable files such as Excel tools for planning and PDF manuals for guidance.

The page provides information about fraudulent support calls, commonly known as the "MICROSOFT scam." It details a form of cyber fraud where criminals pose as Microsoft or other IT company employees, claiming to have discovered a severe security issue on the victim's computer.
